present_season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey and Derek Shepherd navigate their complex relationship, which begins with a one-night stand and evolves as they work together at Seattle Grace Hospital, balancing personal feelings with professional responsibilities amidst hospital drama.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: The episode features Meredith and Derek sharing a romantic moment outside the party, indicating the continuation of their personal relationship. Additionally, they work together professionally during a surgery on a patient, Jerry, which highlights the ongoing entanglement of their personal and professional lives.
present_season_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek'S Professional And Personal Entanglement

present_season_arcs.description: George O'Malley struggles to build his confidence as a surgical intern, facing personal and professional setbacks while striving to meet expectations from peers and mentors.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: In the episode, George interacts with a patient, Mrs. Drake, and participates in discussions with Richard and Bailey about a previous surgery that went wrong. He also reassures Meredith about the surgery complications, showing his involvement and growing confidence in handling medical situations. These actions contribute to his journey of building self-confidence as a surgical intern.
present_season_arcs.title: George O'Malley'S Journey To Self-Confidence

present_season_arcs.description: Izzie Stevens battles stereotypes and seeks acceptance from her colleagues, proving her competence as a former model turned surgical intern, while advocating for her patients and forming bonds with fellow interns.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: In the episode, Izzie is involved in planning a party, which is criticized by Cristina for being too large and unapproved by Meredith. This reflects her struggle to be taken seriously by her peers. Additionally, Izzie argues with her boyfriend Hank about her priorities between work and their relationship, highlighting her dedication to her career and her desire to be respected as a competent surgical intern. These elements contribute to the ongoing arc of Izzie seeking acceptance and proving her competence.
present_season_arcs.title: Izzie Stevens' Fight For Respect

present_season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey navigates the challenges of her medical career while dealing with the shadow of her mother, Ellis Grey, a legendary surgeon, and the emotional impact of Ellis's Alzheimer's disease.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: The episode features Meredith dealing with her mother's condition and the need to sign over her estate, highlighting the emotional impact of Ellis's Alzheimer's disease. Additionally, Meredith's anxiety and struggles in the OR, coupled with her fear of making mistakes, reflect the pressure of living up to her mother's legacy as a legendary surgeon.
present_season_arcs.title: Meredith Grey'S Legacy And Personal Struggles

present_season_arcs.description: Meredith, Cristina, George, and Izzie form a strong support system, navigating the challenges of their surgical internships together, developing deep friendships, and supporting each other through personal and professional trials.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: The episode demonstrates the interns' bond and support network through several interactions: Meredith is supported by George when she worries about the surgery complications; Cristina and George discuss Izzie's party, showing their involvement in each other's lives; and Meredith confronts George about the party, indicating their close relationship. Additionally, Cristina is tasked with gathering information about a previous surgery incident, which ties into the group's professional challenges. The episode concludes with the group cleaning up after the party, reflecting on the events together, further emphasizing their support network.
present_season_arcs.title: Interns' Bond And Support Network

present_season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey's journey as a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital involves overcoming professional challenges, gaining medical expertise, and navigating personal relationships as she establishes herself in a demanding field.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: In this episode, Meredith faces several professional challenges, including her anxiety about potentially harming a patient during heart surgery and dealing with the repercussions of a surgical incident. She takes responsibility for the complications and argues her case to the chief, demonstrating her growth in handling professional situations. Additionally, she navigates personal relationships, such as her romantic encounter with Derek and managing the chaos of an unapproved party at her home. These elements contribute to her journey as a surgical intern, highlighting her professional growth and personal development.
present_season_arcs.title: Meredith Grey'S Professional Growth

present_season_arcs.description: The interns and residents at Seattle Grace Hospital navigate complex power dynamics, dealing with attendings' expectations, peer competition, and the hierarchical structure of the hospital.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: The episode showcases several instances of power dynamics at Seattle Grace Hospital. Meredith struggles with the pressure of her responsibilities in the OR and the expectations from her superiors, such as Burke and the chief. Cristina is tasked with investigating a past surgical error involving Burke, highlighting the hierarchical structure and the need to navigate relationships with attendings. Derek and Alex have a confrontation over patient treatment, reflecting differing approaches and authority levels. Meredith's meeting with the chief about the surgery incident further emphasizes the power dynamics as she takes responsibility and is placed under observation, illustrating the consequences of navigating these dynamics within the hospital.
present_season_arcs.title: Navigating Power Dynamics At Seattle Grace

present_season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey and Derek Shepherd navigate their intricate personal and professional relationship, which begins with a one-night stand and evolves amidst hospital challenges and personal revelations, including the arrival of Derek's estranged wife, Addison.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: The episode features a moment where Meredith and Derek share a romantic encounter outside the party, indicating the ongoing complexity of their relationship. This interaction highlights the personal aspect of their relationship amidst the professional challenges they face at the hospital.
present_season_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek'S Complex Relationship

present_season_arcs.description: George O'Malley explores his identity and builds self-confidence as he navigates misunderstandings about his sexuality, unrequited feelings for Meredith, and forms meaningful connections with patients and colleagues.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: In this episode, George is involved in several key interactions that contribute to his journey of self-discovery and confidence. He discusses the party with Cristina, showing his involvement in social dynamics and his growing confidence in expressing his opinions. He also reassures Meredith about the surgery, demonstrating his supportive nature and ability to connect with colleagues. Additionally, George interacts with Mrs. Drake, a patient frustrated with her past surgeries, which highlights his ability to form meaningful connections with patients. These elements reflect his ongoing development in understanding his identity and building confidence.
present_season_arcs.title: George'S Journey Of Self-Discovery And Confidence

present_season_arcs.description: Cristina Yang's relentless ambition in her surgical career often leads to emotional detachment from patients, as she struggles to balance her drive for success with the compassionate aspects of patient care.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: Cristina's ambition is evident as she is involved in gathering information about a past surgical mistake involving Burke, showing her focus on career advancement and professional knowledge. Her criticism of Izzie's party and lack of involvement in the social aspects of her colleagues' lives further highlight her emotional detachment and prioritization of her career over personal relationships.
present_season_arcs.title: Cristina Yang'S Ambition And Emotional Detachment

present_season_arcs.description: Alex Karev's competitive nature propels his interactions with fellow interns and patients, as he strives to prove himself and grow professionally amidst the challenges of surgical training.
present_season_arcs.presence_explanation: Alex's competitive nature is evident in his skepticism towards Derek's approach to treating a patient suspected of drug-seeking behavior. This interaction highlights Alex's drive to assert his professional judgment and challenge others, which is part of his competitive nature and desire for professional growth.
present_season_arcs.title: Alex'S Competitive Drive And Professional Growth

season_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek'S Professional And Personal Entanglement

season_arcs.title: George O'Malley'S Journey To Self-Confidence

season_arcs.title: Izzie Stevens' Fight For Respect

season_arcs.title: Meredith Grey'S Legacy And Personal Struggles

season_arcs.description: Meredith, Cristina, George, and Izzie form a strong support system, navigating the challenges of their surgical internships together, developing deep friendships, and supporting each other through personal and professional trials.
season_arcs.title: Interns' Bond And Support Network

season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey's journey as a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital involves overcoming professional challenges, gaining medical expertise, and navigating personal relationships as she establishes herself in a demanding field.
season_arcs.title: Meredith Grey'S Professional Growth

season_arcs.description: Cristina Yang is determined to excel in her surgical internship, often leading to rivalry with her peers, particularly Meredith Grey, as she competes for prestigious surgeries and recognition throughout the season.
season_arcs.title: Cristina Yang'S Ambition And Rivalry

season_arcs.description: Miranda Bailey, known for her tough but fair approach, mentors the new interns, guiding them through their first year with high standards, discipline, and empathy. Her leadership shapes their development as future surgeons, balancing rigorous training with understanding and support.
season_arcs.title: Bailey'S Mentorship, Leadership, And Empathy

season_arcs.description: The interns and residents at Seattle Grace Hospital navigate complex power dynamics, dealing with attendings' expectations, peer competition, and the hierarchical structure of the hospital.
season_arcs.title: Navigating Power Dynamics At Seattle Grace

season_arcs.description: The interns at Seattle Grace Hospital face their first major challenge as they diagnose and treat Katie Bryce, a patient with unexplained seizures. Meredith Grey demonstrates her medical acumen by reviving Katie and identifying the cause of her condition, leading to a successful surgery.
season_arcs.title: Medical Case: Katie Bryce'S Seizures

season_arcs.description: Preston Burke performs heart surgery on Tony Savitch, but the operation reveals the heart is too damaged, leading to Tony's death. This case highlights the emotional challenges faced by the interns, particularly George O'Malley, who struggles with the outcome and the promise made to Tony's wife, Gloria.
season_arcs.title: Medical Case: Tony Savitch'S Heart Surgery

season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey demonstrates her medical acumen by correctly diagnosing a pulmonary embolism in patient 4B. This highlights her ability to think critically under pressure in the competitive environment of Seattle Grace Hospital.
season_arcs.title: Medical Case: Patient 4B'S Pulmonary Embolism

season_arcs.description: Cristina Yang and Alex Karev engage in a professional rivalry, competing for surgical opportunities and recognition, while learning to work together as interns.
season_arcs.title: Cristina And Alex'S Professional Rivalry

season_arcs.description: Preston Burke aspires to become Chief of Surgery, navigating hospital politics and competing with Derek Shepherd for the prestigious position.
season_arcs.title: Burke'S Ambition For Chief Of Surgery

season_arcs.description: The interns handle the case of Allison, a rape victim found in the park with serious injuries. The arc follows her surgery, recovery, and the hospital's involvement in identifying and treating the rapist.
season_arcs.title: Medical Case: Allison'S Assault And Recovery

season_arcs.description: Meredith notices a baby with a heart murmur, leading to an investigation and surgery to address the condition.
season_arcs.title: Medical Case: The Blue Baby

season_arcs.description: Izzie navigates a language barrier while treating Ms. Lu, who is worried about her daughter Ahn's injury. Izzie discreetly provides medical assistance to Ahn outside the hospital due to her undocumented status.
season_arcs.title: Medical Case: Ms. Lu And Ahn'S Injuries

season_arcs.description: Meredith Grey and Derek Shepherd navigate their intricate personal and professional relationship, which begins with a one-night stand and evolves amidst hospital challenges and personal revelations, including the arrival of Derek's estranged wife, Addison.
season_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek'S Complex Relationship

season_arcs.description: George O'Malley explores his identity and builds self-confidence as he navigates misunderstandings about his sexuality, unrequited feelings for Meredith, and forms meaningful connections with patients and colleagues.
season_arcs.title: George'S Journey Of Self-Discovery And Confidence

season_arcs.description: Cristina Yang's relentless ambition in her surgical career often leads to emotional detachment from patients, as she struggles to balance her drive for success with the compassionate aspects of patient care.
season_arcs.title: Cristina Yang'S Ambition And Emotional Detachment

season_arcs.description: Izzie Stevens battles stereotypes and seeks respect from her colleagues while facing ethical dilemmas in patient care, particularly in organ donation and advocating for her patients' well-being.
season_arcs.title: Izzie Stevens' Fight For Respect And Ethical Challenges

season_arcs.description: Alex Karev's competitive nature propels his interactions with fellow interns and patients, as he strives to prove himself and grow professionally amidst the challenges of surgical training.
season_arcs.title: Alex'S Competitive Drive And Professional Growth

anthology_arcs.description: Meredith Grey participates in her first heart surgery, holding Mrs. Patterson's heart. During the procedure, Meredith accidentally punctures her glove and worries she might have caused damage to the heart. The patient later experiences complications, leading to a tense situation where Meredith must confront the possibility of her mistake affecting the patient's outcome.
anthology_arcs.title: Medical Case: Mrs. Patterson's Heart Surgery

anthology_arcs.description: George O'Malley assists in the case of Mrs. Drake, a patient with hyperinflated lungs and breathing difficulties. During surgery, a towel is discovered inside her chest, left from a previous operation five years ago. This revelation leads to concerns about hospital liability and the impact of past surgical errors.
anthology_arcs.title: Medical Case: Mrs. Drake's Bullectomy

anthology_arcs.description: Derek Shepherd and Alex Karev handle the case of Jerry Frost, a patient with chronic back pain and a history of drug addiction. The challenge lies in managing his pain while addressing his addiction, leading to a confrontation about the ethics of pain management and the reality of the patient's condition.
anthology_arcs.title: Medical Case: Jerry Frost's Pain Management

genre_arcs.description: Alex Karev grapples with developing empathy and understanding in patient care while striving to prove himself as a competent surgical intern, often clashing with colleagues over differing approaches to treatment.
genre_arcs.title: Alex Karev's Struggle with Empathy and Professional Growth

genre_arcs.description: Derek Shepherd faces ethical dilemmas in patient care, balancing the need to manage pain effectively while addressing issues of addiction and ensuring patient well-being.
genre_arcs.title: Derek Shepherd's Ethical Challenges in Patient Care

genre_arcs.description: The interns at Seattle Grace Hospital, including Meredith, Cristina, George, and Izzie, navigate the hierarchical challenges and power dynamics within the hospital, dealing with the expectations of attendings and the pressures of their surgical training.
genre_arcs.title: Interns' Navigating Hierarchical Challenges at Seattle Grace

soap_arcs.title: Meredith Grey's Struggle with Personal and Professional Responsibilities

soap_arcs.description: Cristina Yang's relentless pursuit of surgical excellence often leads to emotional detachment from her colleagues and patients, as she prioritizes her career ambitions over personal relationships and social interactions.
soap_arcs.title: Cristina Yang's Professional Ambition and Personal Detachment

soap_arcs.description: Izzie Stevens struggles to balance her personal life, including her relationship with her boyfriend Hank, with her dedication to her surgical career, often facing criticism from colleagues about her priorities.
soap_arcs.title: Izzie Stevens' Balancing Act Between Personal Life and Career

soap_arcs.description: Preston Burke and Cristina Yang navigate the complexities of their developing romantic relationship amidst the pressures of their surgical careers, balancing personal feelings with professional responsibilities.
soap_arcs.title: Burke and Cristina's Developing Relationship

enhanced_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek's Professional And Personal Entanglement

enhanced_arcs.description: George O'Malley struggles to build his confidence as a surgical intern, facing personal and professional setbacks while striving to meet expectations from peers and mentors.

George is concerned about the party at Meredith's house and wants to distance himself from it.

enhanced_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith wakes up in the shower after not sleeping for 48 hours. She visits her mother at the nursing home to discuss signing over her estate. Meredith performs heart surgery for the first time and worries she might have damaged the heart. She confesses to Burke about the glove tear during surgery. Meredith's mother refuses to sign the documents due to an Alzheimer's episode.

enhanced_arcs.description: Meredith, Cristina, George, and Izzie form a strong support system, navigating the challenges of their surgical internships together, developing deep friendships, and supporting each other through personal and professional trials.

enhanced_arcs.title: Interns' Bond And Support Network

enhanced_arcs.description: Meredith Grey's journey as a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital involves overcoming professional challenges, gaining medical expertise, and navigating personal relationships as she establishes herself in a demanding field.
enhanced_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: Preston Burke; Richard Webber; George O'Malley; Cristina Yang; Derek Shepherd
enhanced_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith wakes up in the shower, exhausted from lack of sleep. She visits her mother in the nursing home to discuss signing over her estate. Meredith holds a heart during surgery but nods off, causing concern. She worries about puncturing the heart with her fingernail. Meredith confesses her mistake to Burke during a critical moment. She faces a meeting with the chief about the incident. Meredith learns the heart issue was due to the patient's weight loss, not her mistake. She is not fired but will be monitored for a month.
enhanced_arcs.title: Meredith Grey's Professional Growth

enhanced_arcs.description: The interns and residents at Seattle Grace Hospital navigate complex power dynamics, dealing with attendings' expectations, peer competition, and the hierarchical structure of the hospital.

Burke supports Meredith by sharing his own past mistake. Meredith is not fired but will be monitored for a month.

verified_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek's Professional And Personal Entanglement

verified_arcs.description: George O'Malley navigates the challenges of being a surgical intern, gradually building his confidence through personal growth and professional achievements.
verified_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: Meredith Grey; Miranda Bailey; Cristina Yang; Izzie Stevens
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: George feels jealous watching Meredith hold a heart during surgery. George reassures Meredith about her concerns with the heart surgery. George impresses Bailey with his observations on Mrs. Drake's X-rays. George is tasked with staying with Mrs. Drake, who likes him. George is concerned about the party at Meredith's house and wants to distance himself from it.
verified_arcs.title: George O'Malley's Journey To Self-Confidence

verified_arcs.description: Izzie Stevens battles stereotypes and seeks acceptance from her colleagues, proving her competence as a former model turned surgical intern, while advocating for her patients and forming bonds with fellow interns.
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Izzie invites colleagues to a party to introduce her boyfriend. Cristina criticizes Izzie's relationship with Hank. Izzie argues with Hank about her priorities. Hank leaves, highlighting Izzie's struggle to balance personal and professional life.
verified_arcs.title: Izzie Stevens' Fight For Respect

verified_arcs.description: Meredith Grey navigates the challenges of her medical career while dealing with the shadow of her mother, Ellis Grey, a legendary surgeon, and the emotional impact of Ellis's Alzheimer's disease.
verified_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: Ellis Grey; Preston Burke; Richard Webber; George O'Malley
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith wakes up in the shower after not sleeping for 48 hours. She visits her mother at the nursing home to discuss signing over her estate. Meredith performs heart surgery for the first time and worries she might have damaged the heart. She confesses to Burke about the glove tear during surgery. Meredith's mother refuses to sign the documents due to an Alzheimer's episode.
verified_arcs.title: Meredith Grey's Legacy And Personal Struggles

verified_arcs.description: Meredith, Cristina, George, and Izzie form a strong support system, navigating the challenges of their surgical internships together, developing deep friendships, and supporting each other through personal and professional trials.
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith struggles with exhaustion and a potential surgical mistake. George reassures Meredith about the heart surgery. Cristina and George support Meredith during her meeting with the chief. Izzie plans a party to introduce her boyfriend to her friends. The interns clean up after the party, reinforcing their bond.
verified_arcs.title: Interns' Bond And Support Network

verified_arcs.description: Meredith Grey's journey as a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital involves overcoming professional challenges, gaining medical expertise, and navigating personal relationships as she establishes herself in a demanding field.
verified_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: Preston Burke; Richard Webber; George O'Malley; Cristina Yang; Derek Shepherd
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith wakes up in the shower, exhausted from lack of sleep. She visits her mother in the nursing home to discuss signing over her estate. Meredith holds a heart during surgery but nods off, causing concern. She worries about puncturing the heart with her fingernail. Meredith confesses her mistake to Burke during a critical moment. She faces a meeting with the chief about the incident. Meredith learns the heart issue was due to the patient's weight loss, not her mistake. She is not fired but will be monitored for a month.
verified_arcs.title: Meredith Grey's Professional Growth

verified_arcs.description: The interns and residents at Seattle Grace Hospital navigate complex power dynamics, dealing with attendings' expectations, peer competition, and the hierarchical structure of the hospital.
verified_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: Richard Webber; George O'Malley; Miranda Bailey
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith struggles with exhaustion and responsibility as she prepares for her first heart surgery. Meredith accidentally punctures a glove during surgery. Burke notices Meredith's fatigue and questions her performance. Meredith confesses to Burke about the glove incident after complications arise. Meredith and Burke are called to meet with legal to explain the situation. Burke supports Meredith by sharing his own past mistake. Meredith is not fired but will be monitored for a month.
verified_arcs.title: Navigating Power Dynamics At Seattle Grace

verified_arcs.description: Cristina Yang's relentless ambition in her surgical career often leads to emotional detachment from patients and colleagues, as she struggles to balance her drive for success with the compassionate aspects of patient care and personal relationships.
verified_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: George O'Malley; Izzie Stevens; Preston Burke
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Cristina dismisses George's jealousy over Meredith holding a heart. Cristina jokes about Izzie's party invite list, showing her detachment from social events. Cristina is surprised by the towel left in Mrs. Drake and is tasked with gathering information. Cristina awkwardly accepts coffee from Burke, hinting at her emotional detachment. Cristina jokes about Izzie's relationship, showing her emotional distance. Cristina is surprised by Burke's involvement in Mrs. Drake's case. Cristina and Burke have sex in the locker room, showing her struggle with emotional connections.
verified_arcs.title: Cristina Yang's Ambition And Emotional Detachment

verified_arcs.description: Alex Karev's competitive nature propels his interactions with fellow interns and patients, as he strives to prove himself and grow professionally amidst the challenges of surgical training.
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Alex questions a patient's drug-seeking behavior. Derek instructs Alex to treat the pain seriously. Alex is frustrated but follows Derek's orders. Alex and Derek later confront the patient about his addiction. Alex offers to handle post-surgery tasks, allowing Izzie to leave.
verified_arcs.title: Alex Karev's Competitive Drive And Professional Growth

verified_arcs.description: Meredith Grey faces a challenging situation during her first heart surgery when she accidentally punctures her glove, leading to complications with the patient's heart. This arc explores the consequences of her actions and the professional and ethical dilemmas she must navigate.
verified_arcs.interfering_episode_characters: Richard Webber; Mr. Patterson; Nurse Tyler
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith holds Mrs. Patterson's heart during surgery and nods off. Meredith notices her glove is punctured and worries about the heart. Mrs. Patterson experiences complications post-surgery. Meredith confesses to Burke about the glove incident. Burke finds a rupture in the heart wall and explains the situation. Meredith and Burke are informed they must meet with legal.
verified_arcs.title: Medical Case: Mrs. Patterson's Heart Surgery

verified_arcs.description: George O'Malley assists in the case of Mrs. Drake, a patient with hyperinflated lungs and breathing difficulties. During surgery, a towel is discovered inside her chest, left from a previous operation five years ago. This revelation leads to concerns about hospital liability and the impact of past surgical errors.
verified_arcs.main_characters: George O'Malley; Richard Webber; Miranda Bailey
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: George identifies Mrs. Drake's lung issues and suggests a bullectomy. Richard finds a towel left inside Mrs. Drake from a previous operation. Richard and Bailey discuss the implications of the towel discovery. Cristina investigates and finds Burke was involved in the previous surgery. Burke decides to come forward about the mistake.
verified_arcs.title: Medical Case: Mrs. Drake's Bullectomy

verified_arcs.description: Derek Shepherd and Alex Karev navigate the complexities of treating Jerry Frost, a patient with chronic back pain and a history of drug addiction. The arc explores the ethical challenges of pain management in patients with addiction, highlighting the balance between addressing genuine pain and preventing drug misuse.
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Derek and Alex assess Jerry Frost's chronic pain and addiction history. Derek instructs Alex to treat the pain despite addiction concerns. Jerry becomes violent and injures himself. Derek performs surgery on Jerry's subdural hemorrhage. Alex arranges for Jerry's addiction recovery post-surgery.
verified_arcs.title: Medical Case: Jerry Frost's Pain Management

verified_arcs.description: Meredith Grey and Derek Shepherd navigate their complex relationship, which begins with a one-night stand and evolves as they work together at Seattle Grace Hospital, balancing personal feelings with professional responsibilities amidst hospital drama.
verified_arcs.single_episode_progression_string: Meredith and Derek share a moment of tension after surgery. Derek invites Meredith to dinner, but she declines. They flirt and kiss at the party, leading to a sexual encounter in Derek's car. Bailey witnesses their encounter.
verified_arcs.title: Meredith And Derek's Professional And Personal Entanglement
